data.title: Beef Brisket is AMAZING!!
data.text: The beef brisket is unbelievable...it melts in your mouth. I am stayed at a restaraunt that was close to Bono's for a week and I ate at Bono's almost everynight...thats how good it was...I am moving to Denver in the next few months and I can't wait to be that close to one of the best places to eat Beef Brisket!!

data.title: Some of the best .
data.text: What a wonderful place. Food is some of the best.  Perfect for family get together soon.. Great value for the cost.

data.title: Very near Drury Inn & Suites
data.text: Walked to the step up window at Bono's for BBQ as between the hotel's breakfast and happy hour dinner options. Very downhome cowboy type bar and excellent BBQ.  You can elect to take away, eat outside (smoking section) or inside air conditioning.  Great and funny staff.

data.title: Best.BBQ.EVER!!
data.text: Love, love, love this place!  Their BBQ is yummy-service quick and good also.  Great for takeout or dine in.

data.title: I really wanted to enjoy the palce
data.text:
Unfortunately I was underwhelmed.  We had the family feast with pulled pork, Cole slaw, baked beans and potato salad, and kids had mac-n-cheese.

Nothing really had much flavor.  The pork was soft, watery texture, with little flavor.  I did like the potato salad a good bit, but that was the highlight of the meal.  When we told the waitress the the kids meal had no flavor at all, she said, "I know.  We don't season our foods because some people don't like salt and pepper."  Really?  So I really wanted to enjoy our experience and food, but I left disappointed.  Could simply be my taste in BBQ, so try it out and add you thoughts.

data.title: Smoked meat
data.text: Good smoked meat meals with cold beer and great tasting beans.  Not a fancy place but I watched the closing cleanup and it is good and I was amazed at the detail they performed on things like their toaster, etc.  All removable parts were run thru a dish washing machine.

data.title: Great service but the Q was off.
data.text: I ordered the beef brisket.  Overall it had good smoke flavor and a nice pink smoke ring but dry.  It crumbled under fork and I had to use a lot of sauce to get it down.  I also looked at the ingredients on the sauce and it had too many items like preservatives for my liking.  I get it, but I  prefer fresh natural sauce.   I know some of the smaller spots in town make the sauce in-house, without unpronouncible ingredients.  Staff was totally cool.  I am willing to give it another try because I felt the flavor in the meat was there.

data.title: Tasty grub and great service
data.text: After driving all over town trying to feed cranky kids, we decided to try Bono's on the last night of our stay. First impressions went a long way....the place smelled deliciously like smoked barbecue. Our waiter got us seated quickly and brought drinks. Our meals were a couple of mixed chopped sandwiches, hot wings, a kids cheeseburger, and the turkey platter. For an appetizer, we ordered the fried okra. At the restaurants back home, fried okra is always a side but that wasn't a big deal. I asked the waiter to have the cook burn it and the crispy okra was right on point when it came out.....just the way we like it. The meals were tasty and although the sauces were a little different, they complemented the smoked turkey nicely. The waiter was friendly, attentive,  and even gave us a discount for being guests and the Drury Suites next door. Bellies were full and kids were happy. Thanks Bono's !

data.title: Colorado BBQ
data.text:
Ate here the first evening we arrived from KS. We had driven all day and were pretty darn hungry. We asked about the place by while at the 7-11 and we were told that it wouldn't be as good as KC BBQ and this was true. 
I and my daughter both had the special which was a 3 meat plate with 2 sides. They are known for their fried corn on the cob, which my daughter feel in love with. She also tried the Brunswick stew and didn't like it enough to send it back. I had the fried corn on the cob also and thought it was average. I had a sweet potato and it was very small. My son and son in-laws side servings were also very small- and I mean a Dixie cup size serving- and for the price, I thought was poor. The wait staff were pleasant, the meats were average- brisket was dry, the pulled pork was good and the ribs were tender. They have their own sauces- the original has a mustardy taste, which I did like, but I enjoyed the sweet and tangy much more. We ordered the pecan pie to go and it did say it had Burboun in it, and wow ! It did, which makes it tastes less like a pecan pie and more like a shot. Overall, it was fair. One and done for us.

data.title: Disappointing and Disgusting
data.text: We were staying at the Drury and walked next door, rather than driving somewhere else. We walked in and smelled amazing smelling food, but unfortunately the smell was much better than the food. Our party of five ordered anything from a hamburger to the fried fish to the 3 piece combo. The only one that was satisfied was a teenage boy. 3 of us ate less than half of our plates because we could not choke it down. What made it worse, we got our bill and paid nearly $100 for food that went to waste because it was disgusting. We will never eat here again, hopefully another restaurant will come in near the hotel, so we can have the convenience factor of walking to dinner, as for now I think a sandwich from 7/11 would be better than eating here.

data.title: Good BBQ
data.text: The cheeseburger was cooked to order and very good.  I had the wings "dry" and unfortunately they were.  I had the sauce on the side. They would have been better cooked in the BBQ sauce but since I have never eaten here before I did not know the degree of heat for the sauce.  I would recommend the regular BBQ or sweet sauce. It seems like a very popular place with the locals.  The staff were friendly and informative about the food.  The Bourbon Pecan Pie was excellent!

data.title: I am still stuffed
data.text:
I love barbecue. And Bonos did not disappoint. Had the three meat combo with pulled pork, brisket(my measuring stick) St Louis style ribs and an extra link of sausage. The pork was moist and delicious itself without any sauces added. The ribs were succulent and the meat fell off the bone. And the brisket was cooked just right. The hot sausage was okay, nothing special. 

They offer a nice selection of sauces. The original seems to be more mustard based but not vinegary as a SC sauce would be. I really enjoyed the hickory red and the hot. Very nicely flavored and not killer hot. 

We had four different desserts and the banana pudding with vanilla wafers, whipped cream and big hunks of banana was the hands down winner. The snicker pie was fair, pecan pie dry and key lime pie was pretty good. 

Service was very efficient and friendly. The kitchen screwed up our orders of sides but our server quickly took care of it. 

Looking forward to another visit.

data.title: Bono's Pit BBQ - Englewood, CO
data.text: The food is good, prices are reasonable and the waitstaff make sure you are taken care of.  You get plenty of food and  lots of choices.

data.title: So delicious!
data.text: The food here is really delicious!  Our favorites were the beef brisket (the best I have ever had) and the pork and beans. We will definitely be returning soon!

data.title: Perfect location when staying at the Drury Inn
data.text: We watched an Avs game and had dinner while staying at the Drury. They accommodated our group of 10 no problem. Food was decent and drinks were cold. No complaints!

data.title: great quick lunch
data.text: doing some shopping around the tech center, got real hungry and did not want a high dollar fancy place, my son suggested this place , it was quick and very good and the price was cheep for that area. will be going back !

data.title: Need Help with their Sauce Application
data.text:
We went to this restaurant by default since they were located adjacent to the Drury Inn & Suites and there wasn't anything else within easy walking distance on a cold night.  

We felt they did a good job of smoking and cooking but their choice of sauce was overwhelming in our opinion.  We prefer a more subtle sauce that compliments the BBQ but will grant that others are of a different opinion.  Our orders were served more than promptly and our waitress was quite attentive.

data.title: Great at large groups, good BBQ
data.text: We had a group of 12 (5 kids) and they seated us immediately at 12:45 on Sunday. Grilled corn on the cob a favorite side. Salads ($1 upcharge) were good. Everyone happy with BBQ (Turkey, brisket, pork), Service great! Thanks Laurie!

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: First trip to this restaurant. The onion rings were the worst I have ever had.  Heavily breaded and way overdone. Terrible.  Do not recommend. The pork sandwich was ok with a side of cole slaw, a long way from outstanding or even good. No comparison to east coast (NC) barbeque. The wait staff was helpful and did check in frequently. Overall, just very disappointing. Would not recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Great BBQue
data.text: This is  right next door. It was great place to eat... The wait staff was very friendly. Good BBQ. You can show your hotel key and get 10% off
